channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: US Postal Service chief to testify at Congress amid uproar over mail-in voting
Schiff: This is a shocking betrayal of our democracy
item.description: Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) says the emergency needs of the US Postal Service must be addressed, and accuses President Donald Trump of not wanting to improve the function of the USPS in an attempt to disenfranchise voters.

item.title: CNN Poll of Polls: Biden's lead is back in single digits
'Leave!' chant protesters. Not 'until you kill me', responds Belarus' embattled leader
Asia's prisons are filling up with women. Many are victims of the war on drugs
Historic protests erupt against God-like monarchy in Thailand
item.description: It was an act unthinkable in Thailand mere months ago -- an estimated 10,000 anti-government protesters packing Bangkok's Democracy Monument on Sunday, with some calling for reform of the country's monarchy.

item.title: Covid-19 is now the No. 3 cause of death in the US
Covid-19 positivity rates are climbing across the US
What to watch on the first night of the Democratic convention
item.description: The Democratic National Convention kicks off Monday with a two-hour virtual event built on a theme of unity.

item.title: Iran paid bounties on US troops, intel shows
item.description: US intelligence agencies assessed that Iran offered bounties to Taliban fighters for targeting American and coalition troops in Afghanistan, identifying payments linked to at least six attacks carried out by the militant group just last year alone, including a suicide bombing at a US air base in December, CNN has learned.

item.title: Death Valley just recorded the hottest temperature on Earth
item.description: Death Valley was the hottest place on Earth on Sunday. If verified, it could be the hottest temperature recorded in the world since 1913.

item.title: Watch the moment Melania appears to turn away from President Trump
item.description: Social media took notice of a seemingly disconnected moment between the President and First Lady this weekend. But a closer look shows what really happened.

item.title: Sharon Stone shares sister's Covid-19 diagnosis: 'One of you Non-Mask wearers did this'
item.description: Actress Sharon Stone shared her sister's experience with Covid-19 on Instagram, and she said people who don't wear masks are to blame.

item.title: Restaurant apologizes for weighing diners to determine how much they should eat
item.description: A restaurant chain in southern China has issued a public apology for weighing diners before they entered the premises as part of a national campaign to reduce food waste.

item.title: See the precautions a Scottish school is taking as children return to class
item.description: CNN's Max Foster shows us how one school in Scotland has prepared to reopen and what safety measures they have put in place.

item.title: Kamala Harris responds to Trump's birther attacks
item.description: • Don Lemon: Guess how many GOP colleagues stood up for Kamala Harris? • Meadows says Harris is eligible to be VP • Analysis: Harris pick is a hit with voters

item.title: It's long past time for Joe Biden to start taking questions from the press
item.description: Joe Biden held two public events last week introducing California Sen. Kamala Harris as his vice presidential pick. He took zero questions from the press.

item.title: Two men charged in long-unsolved murder of Run-DMC's Jam Master Jay
item.description: Prosecutors are set to announce charges against two people in the unsolved murder of Jam Master Jay, the pioneering DJ of Run-DMC who was killed in 2002, according to a law enforcement source.

item.title: Cyberattack shuts down Canadian government accounts
item.description: The Canadian government said it was forced to shut down most of its online portals on the weekend after a sustained cyberattack over the last several days.

item.title: Trump administration announces plans to drill in Arctic National Wildlife Refuge
item.description: Interior Secretary David Bernhardt on Monday announced plans for an oil and gas leasing program in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, clearing the way for drilling in the remote Alaskan area.

item.title: This is what Tijuana's red light district looks like during pandemic
item.description: Despite the coronavirus pandemic, the red light district in Tijuana, Mexico, is still bustling with tourists. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

item.title: New Dolly Parton mural honors singer and her thoughts on Black Lives Matter
item.description: A mural paying tribute to country singer and Tennessee native Dolly Parton and her stance on the Black Lives Matter movement has emerged outside a known music venue in Nashville.

item.title: Rebel Wilson shows off major weight loss
item.description: If you picked up some weight while quarantining, you can look to Rebel Wilson for inspiration.

item.title: Man tried to kidnap WWE star in her home
item.description: A South Carolina man obsessed with WWE star Sonya Deville was arrested Sunday after he drove to Florida and, armed with a knife, plastic zip ties, duct tape and Mace, tried to kidnap the wrestler in her home, authorities said.

item.title: 'The Office' star shares messages from racist trolls
item.description: 'The Office" actor Leslie David Baker has received racist hateful attacks for trying to produce a spinoff of the series starring his character Stanley Hudson. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: 'The Crown' has cast Princess Diana
item.description: Elizabeth Debicki is set to play Diana, Princess of Wales in the final seasons of "The Crown," makers of the hit Netflix series announced on Sunday.

item.title: Shania Twain speaks about her battle with Lyme disease
item.description: Country music star Shania Twain has said she feared she would never be able to sing again, after Lyme disease left her with nerve damage to her vocal cords.

item.title: Golf faces 'confusion' over players hitting huge drives
item.description: When Bryson DeChambeau, who had put on 40 pounds during lockdown as the PGA Tour suspended play from mid-March to mid-June, stepped onto the first tee at Muirfield Village last month at the Memorial Tournament, everyone was anticipating fireworks.

item.title: World No. 2 Halep is latest player to pull out of US Open
item.description: Women's world No. 2 Simona Halep will not travel to New York to play in this year's US Open.

item.title: Ed Sheeran really wishes his demo album wasn't for sale
item.description: A rare copy of Ed Sheeran's first demo album is being auctioned -- and somewhere out there, he is dying of embarrassment.

item.title: WHO reports record global Covid-19 increase over 24 hours
item.description: As the World Health Organization reported a global record of new Covid-19 cases within a 24-hour period over the weekend, CNN's Kim Brunhuber reports on how the pandemic is spreading across the world.

item.title: Microsoft is resurrecting its 38-year-old flight simulator game
item.description: After a 14-year hiatus, Microsoft is launching a new version of its "Flight Simulator" video game — now with features like live weather and traffic as well as a massive world map.

item.title: Nudes, prudes and swingers: Hedonism II adapts to the pandemic era
item.description: During the time I spent living with my husband next door to Hedonism II resort in Jamaica, I often suspected the neighbors were having more fun than we were.

item.title: Early humans knew how to make comfy, pest-free beds, study says
item.description: As long as humans have been around, they've been dealing with bedbugs. But it turns out that our oldest ancestors knew how to deal with pests.

item.title: 8 houses built in impossible places
item.description: Architecture can flirt with nature in expressive yet subtle ways. The idea in architecture is often to harmonize, not dominate, the landscapes. This can prove a challenge, however, when faced with steep slopes, cliff faces and mountainsides.

item.title: See video from controversial party near Georgia college
item.description: CNN's Natasha Chen reports that a private party near a North Georgia college drew large groups of students, without apparent Covid-19 precautions being exercised.

item.title: 14,000-year-old puppy's unexpected final meal discovered
item.description: Scientists studying the body of a perfectly preserved Ice Age puppy have made an unexpected discovery -- a piece of what could be one of the last woolly rhinos inside its stomach.

item.title: Machine Gun Kelly only wants to date Megan Fox, 'probably ever'
item.description: Machine Gun Kelly is really, really off the market.

item.title: Police pick up penguin found waddling along rural English road
item.description: Police in central England were surprised to find a penguin waddling along a village street on Sunday morning.

item.title: RB Leipzig's US sensation Tyler Adams driven on by the 'sacrifices' of his family
item.description: 'Where do you see yourself in five years?' is a popular question you might find asked at a job interview, or a hopeful parent might inquire of their teenager. But, in this current climate, you would be forgiven if the query was truncated a bit -- more of a five-day plan than a five-year one.

item.title: National Zoo's giant panda got an ultrasound. This is what the vets saw
item.description: Vets detected fetal tissue after giving Mei Xiang, a giant panda at the Smithsonian's National Zoo in DC, an ultrasound. She could give birth within days.

item.title: Beijing museum shines a light on China's official Covid-19 narrative
item.description: The world may be in the midst of a global pandemic, but visitors to a new Beijing exhibition could be forgiven for thinking the battle has already been won.

item.title: Democrats launch emergency effort to thwart President's apparent attempt to squeeze USPS to suppress voting
item.description: Democrats are launching an emergency effort to thwart what they warn is President Donald Trump's attempt to squeeze the US Postal Service -- one of the country's most beloved institutions -- to suppress the vote in November's election.

item.title: USPS chief to testify at Congress amid mail-in voting uproar
item.description: The House is set to return on Saturday to vote on legislation related to the US Postal Service, House Democratic leaders announced Monday, with an eye toward providing the financially strapped agency with $25 billion in funding despite White House objections.

item.title: Voters receive absentee ballot forms with Trump's face on them
item.description: Given the crisis facing the United States Postal Service before a presidential election, the last thing John Herter expected to receive in the mail Saturday was an absentee ballot request form with President Donald Trump's face on it.

item.title: Bernstein: This will be the GOP's shame for generations
item.description: Legendary Watergate journalist Carl Bernstein speaks with CNN's Brian Stelter about what President Trump's attacks on mail-in voting mean for our democracy.

item.title: McConnell says he doesn't share Trump's 'concern' about USPS
item.description: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Monday said he doesn't share President Donald Trump's "concern" surrounding the United States Postal Service and mail-in voting ahead of the November election and said the agency "is going to be just fine."

item.title: If Trump loses and won't leave, it could get ugly
item.description: President Donald Trump talks a lot about staying in office longer than the two-term, eight-year limit allowed by the Constitution. People may assume he's joking -- just needling his enemies. He couldn't possibly be serious, could he?

item.title: CNN Poll of Polls: Biden's lead is back in single digits
item.description: • Former senior Trump administration official endorses Biden • Analysis: It's long past time for Biden to take questions from press

item.title: 'Leave!' chant protesters. Not 'until you kill me', responds Belarus' embattled leader
